title: "If she is so good in bed you can stay there": Scorned lover's plasters furious posters across town raging against cheating partner
text:
Linda takes aim at Graham and his mistress in these savage posters (Photo: Mark Hebert Facebook) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A furious woman covered an entire town in posters to rage against her cheating partner. 
The signs, which depict a love heart tied in a noose, appeared all over Warwick as a scorned woman called Linda took aim at adulterous Graham. 
The laminated posters say she has thrown the keys to his Mercedes in a canal, changed the locks and maxed out his credit cards. 
In a barbed comment about Graham's mistress, the posters say: "If she is so good in bed you can stay there!" 
The signs give real-life meaning to the saying 'hell hath no fury like a woman scorned'. The posters have appeared all over Warwick (Photo: Mark Hebert Facebook) The signs say Linda has thrown Graham's car keys in a canal, changed the locks and maxed out his credit cards (Photo: Mark Hebert Facebook) Read More 
Mark Hebert spotted the signs and posted images on Facebook, saying: "Posters all over Warwick. Naughty Graham." 
This sparked a debate about the rights and wrongs of Mark and Linda's tricky situation. 
Pauline Devlin simply wrote: "Good on ya Linda." 
But Richard Consoli said: "Too many stereotypes sometimes. If someone maxes the credit card, throws keys in the canal, I don't see that as a very mature way of dealing with relationship probs." Read More 
Twitter user @HelenJaneWyatt, who saw one of the posters, said: "Looks like Graham has been busted and the whole of Warwick know about it. Damn right too." 
And @The_IGR added: "Looks like Graham from #Warwick has been a naughty boy." 
StevoBee posted another image of a poster, writing: "Appearing all round Warwick on lampposts. Graham might be regretting his little fling!" 
Andrew Robins said: "Saw these all over Warwick today. I think Graham might be in trouble #naughtyboy #womanscorned" 
The posters appear to have been professionally printed, with a link to the website of a design company called Throwing Rocks at the bottom of each one. Like us on Facebook
